The humane thing to do would be catch-and-release.

> 
> The humane thing to do would be catch-and-release.

 No, no, we aren't humane. If we purposley deform Kerbals for entertainment, we can keep a giant space rock in orbit forever.

They make good pets.

[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pet_Rock](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pet_Rock)
Could you build thrusters on it and put it into orbit around Kerbin and have another permanent satellite?
Land it at the KSC!
Put a small mining setup on it, along with an engine. Get the ore>fuel and fuel consumption in balance and you have a ship that runs off ore.
Bring it back to Kerbin orbit and mine it for fuel -> gas station.
serious question: whats the crash tolerance of an asteroid? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Take a surface sample.
I think I will try crashing it into KSC. Has anyone done this before? Will it leave a crater? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
No, but if you hit the buildings they will be destroyed.

> 
> No, but if you hit the buildings they will be destroyed.

Better try it in real life first before risking my career save.

(A Few Weeks Later)

\*Journal writing\*

"Day 21, it has been 3 weeks since I've tested what would happen if I pulled an asteroid to Kerbin, and..."
Anchor for a space station. Use Klaws to stick docking ports to it.

Use it as a resource mine. It just needs a couple of mining ships clawed onto it at odd angles, with a few eccentric prospectors flying around the place. Once you've attached a drill, resource converter, a couple of fuel tanks and an engine, you can more easily move it into a lower orbit for use as a self-refilling fuel depot.

Or attempt to bomb KSC with it, your choice ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Or catch another and bring them together with ... the KLAAAAAAAAAAAAW.

And then post a Pic, you will be Epic ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif).

Good Hunting and all the best.
please refrain from feeding it, the asteroid is a migratory creature and interrupting its tendency to move along could be devastating to the natural order of things.

Thanks for all the great ideas. I was going to use it as a fuel depot until I saw another post on here saying how little fuel you can actually get out of them. So to destroy KSC it is, I guess.
